byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Saudi Arabian government arrests Ahmed al-Mughassil, who is accused of organizing 1996 bombing of building in Khobar Towers building complex that killed 19 United States airmen and left 400 people wounded; Mughassil was leader of Iranian-backed Saudi militant group Hezbollah al-Hijaz, and arrest underscores tensions between US and Iran even as two seek to secure deal regarding Iran's nuclear weapons.
lead_paragraph: The suspect, Ahmed al-Mughassil, was identified in an American federal indictment as a ringleader in the bombing that killed 19 members of the American military.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia Said to Arrest Suspect in 1996 Khobar Towers Bombing
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia Said to Arrest Suspect in ’96 Khobar Towers Bombing

snippet: The suspect, Ahmed al-Mughassil, was identified in an American federal indictment as a ringleader in the bombing that killed 19 members of the American military.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
